leaf_cluster.leaf_cluster_name: 生信-组学整合与知识图谱生态
leaf_cluster.task_chain: 对齐→融合→推理→检索→证据链→评测

queries: [WEB] biomedical knowledge graph construction tools github

tools.name: Grid Map
tools.one_line_profile: Universal grid map library for mobile robotic mapping and terrain modeling
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library for managing two-dimensional grid maps with multiple data layers, commonly used in mobile robotics for terrain mapping, elevation modeling, and navigation.

tools.name: Blue Brain Nexus
tools.one_line_profile: Data and knowledge graph management platform for data-driven science
tools.detailed_description: A provenance-based, semantic data management platform that enables scientists to build, store, query, and share knowledge graphs, specifically designed for data-driven science like neuroscience.

tools.name: Genesis
tools.one_line_profile: Generative world platform for general-purpose robotics and embodied AI
tools.detailed_description: A physics-based simulation platform designed for general-purpose robotics and embodied AI learning, enabling the generation of diverse environments and scenarios for training agents.

tools.name: KG-COVID-19
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for producing a COVID-19 knowledge graph
tools.detailed_description: A framework and pipeline instance from the KG-Hub ecosystem designed to ingest, transform, and merge various biomedical datasets into a structured knowledge graph specifically for COVID-19 research.

tools.name: kg-obo
tools.one_line_profile: ETL tool to transform OBO ontologies into KGX format
tools.detailed_description: A utility package within the KG-Hub ecosystem that transforms OBO (Open Biological and Biomedical Ontology) ontologies into KGX TSV format and OBO JSON, facilitating their integration into knowledge graphs.

tools.name: Clinical Knowledge Graph (CKG)
tools.one_line_profile: Platform for biomedical data integration and automated knowledge discovery
tools.detailed_description: An open-source platform that integrates experimental proteomics data with diverse biomedical databases into a graph database, enabling automated analysis, knowledge discovery, and report generation for clinical proteomics.

tools.name: Halyard
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable RDF triplestore based on HBase
tools.detailed_description: A horizontally scalable RDF triplestore built on top of Apache HBase, designed for the integration and SPARQL querying of extremely large semantic data models and knowledge graphs.

tools.name: Isaac GR00T
tools.one_line_profile: Foundation model for generalist robot learning
tools.detailed_description: A foundation model designed for generalist robots, enabling them to understand multimodal instructions and perform tasks in simulation and real-world environments, facilitating embodied AI research.

tools.name: KAG
tools.one_line_profile: Knowledge Augmented Generation framework for logical reasoning and retrieval
tools.detailed_description: A framework combining knowledge graphs (OpenSPG) and LLMs to perform logical form-guided reasoning and retrieval, addressing limitations of vector-based RAG in professional domain knowledge bases.

tools.name: Drake
tools.one_line_profile: Model-based design and verification library for robotics
tools.detailed_description: A C++ toolbox for analyzing the dynamics of robots and building control systems, with a heavy emphasis on optimization-based design and verification.

tools.name: Schematic
tools.one_line_profile: Biomedical data model and metadata management package
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for managing biomedical data models and metadata ingress, facilitating the validation and submission of data to platforms like Synapse, often used in large-scale consortiums.

tools.name: GCN-SC
tools.one_line_profile: Graph convolutional network framework for single-cell multi-omics integration
tools.detailed_description: A universal framework utilizing graph convolutional networks to integrate single-cell multi-omics data, facilitating downstream analysis like clustering and cell type identification.

tools.name: MOCO-GCN
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-omics data integration using Co-training Graph Convolutional Networks
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning method for multi-omics integration that employs Two-view Co-training GCNs and a View Correlation Discovery Network to learn features and integrate data for cancer subtype classification.

tools.name: biotoolsSchema
tools.one_line_profile: Data model and schema for describing computational tools in life sciences
tools.detailed_description: The official XML and JSON schema definitions for bio.tools, providing a standardized data model to describe software, databases, and services in bioinformatics.

tools.name: BioChatter
tools.one_line_profile: Backend library for conversational AI in biomedicine
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed to orchestrate the interaction between Large Language Models (LLMs) and biomedical data/knowledge graphs, facilitating the creation of conversational AI applications for research.

tools.name: BioCypher
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for creating biomedical knowledge graphs
tools.detailed_description: A framework that streamlines the creation of biomedical knowledge graphs by providing a modular system to map, transform, and load data from various sources into graph databases, ensuring interoperability and reproducibility.

tools.name: patient-kg
tools.one_line_profile: BioCypher pipeline for clinical patient data knowledge graphs
tools.detailed_description: A specific implementation of the BioCypher framework designed to ingest and structure clinical patient data (using standards like ICD10, SNOMED CT) into a knowledge graph for analysis.

tools.name: Biolink Model
tools.one_line_profile: High-level data model for biological entities and relationships
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive data model that defines a standard hierarchy of biomedical entities (genes, diseases, chemicals) and their relationships, serving as the schema for many biomedical knowledge graphs.

tools.name: Biolink Model Toolkit
tools.one_line_profile: Python toolkit for working with the Biolink Model
tools.detailed_description: A utility library providing functions to programmatically access, traverse, and validate data against the Biolink Model schema.

tools.name: KGX
tools.one_line_profile: Knowledge Graph Exchange utility
tools.detailed_description: A Python library and command-line tool for exchanging knowledge graphs in various formats (RDF, TSV, JSON-LD) and validating them against the Biolink Model.

tools.name: Biomappings
tools.one_line_profile: Curated mappings between biological entities and Python access tools
tools.detailed_description: A community-curated repository of mappings between biomedical identifiers (e.g., different ontologies) that are missing from primary sources, including a Python package to access and utilize these mappings.

tools.name: Bioregistry
tools.one_line_profile: Integrative registry of biological databases and ontologies
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive registry and Python library for resolving, normalizing, and accessing metadata about biological databases, ontologies, and nomenclatures.

tools.name: PyOBO
tools.one_line_profile: Python package for handling OBO ontologies
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for loading, parsing, and interacting with biomedical ontologies and terminologies, specifically focusing on OBO formats and identifier mapping.

tools.name: GTSAM
tools.one_line_profile: Library for smoothing and mapping using factor graphs
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library (with Python wrappers) implementing smoothing and mapping (SAM) techniques for robotics and computer vision, utilizing factor graphs and Bayes networks for optimization.

tools.name: Bullet Physics SDK
tools.one_line_profile: Real-time collision detection and multi-physics simulation
tools.detailed_description: A professional open-source physics engine for simulating rigid body dynamics, soft body dynamics, and collision detection, widely used in robotics simulation and VR.

tools.name: PheKnowLator
tools.one_line_profile: Heterogeneous biomedical knowledge graph construction
tools.detailed_description: A Python ecosystem for constructing heterogeneous biomedical knowledge graphs from various ontologies and data sources, supporting alternative semantic models.

tools.name: CHOP Data Models
tools.one_line_profile: Biomedical data models in parseable formats
tools.detailed_description: A collection of data models for biomedical research (e.g., clinical, genomic) provided in machine-readable formats to facilitate standardization and interoperability.

tools.name: DocumentGraph
tools.one_line_profile: ETL pipeline for extracting text to Neo4j knowledge graph
tools.detailed_description: A Python package that provides an ETL pipeline to extract, process, and structure text from documents into a Neo4j knowledge graph, facilitating unstructured data integration.

tools.name: semantic-pydantic
tools.one_line_profile: Semantic annotation for Pydantic models using Bioregistry
tools.detailed_description: A library to annotate Pydantic data models and FastAPI endpoints with semantic metadata from the Bioregistry, enhancing FAIRness of biomedical data services.

tools.name: Webots
tools.one_line_profile: Open source robot simulator
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive robot simulator that provides a complete development environment to model, program, and simulate robots, widely used in robotics research and education.

tools.name: BindingDB Processor
tools.one_line_profile: Scripts to process BindingDB for Hetionet
tools.detailed_description: A set of scripts to process and transform data from BindingDB (drug-target binding affinities) into a format suitable for integration into heterogeneous networks like Hetionet.

tools.name: Disease Ontology Processor
tools.one_line_profile: Extensions and processing for Disease Ontology
tools.detailed_description: Scripts and resources to process the Disease Ontology (DO), creating user-friendly extensions and slim versions for integration into biomedical knowledge graphs.

tools.name: DisGeNET Processor
tools.one_line_profile: Processing DisGeNET for Hetionet integration
tools.detailed_description: Pipelines to process the DisGeNET database of gene-disease associations, filtering and formatting the data for inclusion in the Hetionet knowledge graph.

tools.name: Hetionet Integrator
tools.one_line_profile: Integration scripts for Hetionet v1.0
tools.detailed_description: The core integration scripts and resources used to construct Hetionet v1.0, a heterogeneous network designed for drug repurposing, combining data from multiple biomedical sources.

tools.name: MeSH Processor
tools.one_line_profile: Processing and extending MeSH vocabulary
tools.detailed_description: Tools to process the Medical Subject Headings (MeSH) vocabulary, creating user-friendly formats and hierarchies for use in biomedical data integration and knowledge graphs.

tools.name: DORA
tools.one_line_profile: Dataflow-Oriented Robotic Architecture middleware
tools.detailed_description: A middleware designed to simplify the creation of AI-based robotic applications using a low-latency, distributed dataflow architecture, allowing applications to be modeled as directed graphs.

tools.name: GLUE
tools.one_line_profile: Graph-linked unified embedding for single-cell multi-omics integration
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning framework designed to integrate unpaired single-cell multi-omics data (e.g., scRNA-seq and scATAC-seq) by learning a joint embedding graph and aligning regulatory interactions.

tools.name: GraphOmics
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive dashboard for exploring and integrating multi-omics data
tools.detailed_description: A web-based tool for the interactive exploration and integration of transcriptomics, proteomics, and metabolomics data, allowing users to visualize relationships and map data onto biological pathways.

tools.name: grinn
tools.one_line_profile: Graph database and R package for omics data integration
tools.detailed_description: A software platform that combines a graph database (Neo4j) with an R package to facilitate the integration, management, and analysis of multi-omics data, reconstructing relationships between metabolites, genes, and proteins.

tools.name: prefixmaps
tools.one_line_profile: Library for managing semantic prefix maps and CURIEs
tools.detailed_description: A Python library and registry for resolving semantic prefixes (CURIEs) to IRIs, essential for Knowledge Graph construction, data normalization, and interoperability in biomedical ontologies.

tools.name: PrimeKG
tools.one_line_profile: Precision Medicine Knowledge Graph construction pipeline
tools.detailed_description: The codebase for generating PrimeKG, a comprehensive multimodal knowledge graph designed for precision medicine that integrates data from various biomedical databases to support disease-drug-gene analysis.

tools.name: monarch-ingest
tools.one_line_profile: ETL pipeline for the Monarch Initiative Knowledge Graph
tools.detailed_description: The data ingestion and transformation system for the Monarch Initiative, utilizing Koza to convert diverse biological data sources into a unified Knowledge Graph structure for phenotype-genotype analysis.

tools.name: monarchr
tools.one_line_profile: R interface for Monarch Initiative Knowledge Graph
tools.detailed_description: An R package designed to facilitate the retrieval, manipulation, and analysis of data from the Monarch Initiative Knowledge Graph and other KGX-formatted graphs.

tools.name: Morph-KGC
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable RML-based Knowledge Graph generation engine
tools.detailed_description: A powerful engine that constructs RDF knowledge graphs from heterogeneous data sources (such as relational databases and tabular files) using RML (RDF Mapping Language) mappings, optimized for performance.

tools.name: Disease_ontologies_for_knowledge_graphs
tools.one_line_profile: Knowledge base solution for integrating disease ontologies
tools.detailed_description: A knowledge base solution that utilizes Grakn core and disease ontology cross-references to facilitate easy switching between ontology hierarchies for data integration purposes in biomedical knowledge graphs.

tools.name: LLM Graph Builder
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for constructing knowledge graphs from unstructured data using LLMs
tools.detailed_description: A Neo4j-based tool that leverages Large Language Models (LLMs) to extract entities and relationships from unstructured text data, automating the construction of knowledge graphs.

tools.name: OntoWeaver
tools.one_line_profile: Integration of heterogeneous data into Semantic Knowledge Graphs
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed to facilitate the integration of heterogeneous iterable data (such as tabular data) into Semantic Knowledge Graph databases by mapping data to ontologies.

tools.name: Open Semantic Search
tools.one_line_profile: Integrated search engine and text mining platform with KG support
tools.detailed_description: An open-source platform combining a search engine with text mining and analytics capabilities. It includes ETL pipelines for document processing, OCR, Named Entity Recognition (NER), and integration with knowledge graphs and ontologies.

tools.name: PyBEL
tools.one_line_profile: Python ecosystem for Biological Expression Language (BEL)
tools.detailed_description: A pure Python software ecosystem for parsing, validating, compiling, and converting networks encoded in the Biological Expression Language (BEL), facilitating the handling of biological knowledge graphs.

tools.name: MOGONET
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-Omics Graph Convolutional Networks for biomedical classification
tools.detailed_description: A framework for multi-omics data integrative analysis using Graph Convolutional Networks (GCNs) for classification tasks in biomedical applications, such as cancer subtype identification.

tools.name: Unipop
tools.one_line_profile: Data Integration Graph virtualization engine
tools.detailed_description: A data federation and virtualization engine that allows querying various non-graph data sources (like Elasticsearch, JDBC) as a virtual graph, facilitating data integration for knowledge graphs.

tools.name: UBKG-ETL
tools.one_line_profile: ETL framework for Unified Biomedical Knowledge Graph
tools.detailed_description: A framework developed by the HuBMAP consortium to combine data from UMLS and other sources into a set of CSV files for importing into Neo4j to build a Unified Biomedical Knowledge Graph (UBKG).
